com.illumina.basespace

Interface ApiClient


  • public interface ApiClient
    Defines the operations that can be performed against the BaseSpace API
    Author:
    bking

      • startMultipartUpload

        GetFileResponse startMultipartUpload(AppResultCompact appresult,
                                   String fileName,
                                   String contentType,
                                   String directory)
        Start a multipart upload for an appresult. Requires WRITE access to the AppResult to which the file belongs
        Parameters:
        appresult - AppResult to which the file belongs
        fileName - The name of the file as it will be in the AppResult
        contentType - the content type of the file being uploaded. This header is required. When downloading this file, the same Content-Type will be returned
        directory - Use if the data has a directory structure. This will create a directory within the AppResult to place this file
        Returns:
        the single response

      • uploadFilePart

        GetFileUploadResponse uploadFilePart(FileCompact file,
                                   int partNumber,
                                   String MD5Hash,
                                   InputStream part)
        To upload file parts to the particular file Id. Parts may be uploaded in parallel and, in the event that the connection fails, the upload for each part may be retried. The parts will be sorted in ascending order regardless of the order of upload (i.e. part 5 can be uploaded before part 4, but will still be sorted normally once fully uploaded). Requires WRITE access to a particular file
        Parameters:
        file - File for which a part will be uploaded
        partNumber - Each part must be numbered from 1 to 10000, when uploaded the file's parts will be sorted in ascending order.
        MD5Hash - (Optional, can be null) A base64 encoded 128bit MD5 checksum may be provided prior to the upload, which will be checked by the server. By providing a computed value, an app can ensure that the checksum is matched after upload. If the server-calculated value does not match the provided value, the upload will be rejected. Although it is optional, it is highly recommended to ensure data integrity after upload
        part - stream for the file part
        Returns:
        the single response

      • setMultipartUploadStatus

        GetFileResponse setMultipartUploadStatus(FileCompact file,
                                       UploadStatus status)
        Change the upload status for a multi-part file upload
        Parameters:
        file - File for which status will be changed
        status - The status of the upload
        Returns:
        the single response
